content:
The chunk discusses advanced rendering options for point primitives in Panda3D, specifically enabling perspective scaling for points rendered as sprites or particle effects.

In addition to ordinary thick points, which are always the same size no matter how far they are from the camera, you can also use nodePath.set_render_mode_perspective() <.NodePath.set_render_mode_perspective> to enable a mode in which the points scale according to their distance from the camera. This makes the points appear more like real objects in the 3-D scene, and is particularly useful for rendering sprite polygons, for instance for particle effects. In fact, Panda's SpriteParticleRenderer <particle-renderers> takes advantage of this render mode. (This perspective mode works only for points; it does not affect line segments.)
